alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Graham; Norton; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:59PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Norton, northeastern Sheridan, eastern Decatur, northern Graham and eastern Red Willow Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 759 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Medicine Creek Reservoir State Recreation Area to 5 miles southwest of Norcatur to near Dresden. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Norcatur around 805 PM CDT. Clayton around 810 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lenora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
